SEARCH
Package nl.pim16aap2.testing.logging

Class LogAssertionsUtil

java.lang.Object
nl.pim16aap2.testing.logging.LogAssertionsUtil
public final class LogAssertionsUtil extends Object
Represents a set of utility methods to assert logs.

To use this utility, you should use the WithLogCapture annotation on your test class. This will set up log capturing for your test and make the logs available for assertions.

  • Method Details

    • assertLogged

      public static void assertLogged(nl.altindag.log.LogCaptor logCaptor, int position, String message, LogAssertionsUtil.MessageComparisonMethod comparisonMethod)
      Ensures that a message was logged. The assertion will fail if the message was not logged.
      Parameters:
      logCaptor - The log captor to get the log event from.
      position - The position of the log event to check. 0 means the first (oldest) log event, 1 means the second, etc.

      If the position is negative, the position will be relative to the end of the log events. For example, -1 will get the last log event, -2 will get the second to last, etc.

      message - The expected message that was logged.
      comparisonMethod - The method to use when comparing the expected and actual messages.

    • assertLogged

      public static void assertLogged(nl.altindag.log.LogCaptor logCaptor, String message)
      Ensures that a throwable was logged. The assertion will fail if the throwable was not logged.

      Shortcut for assertLogged(LogCaptor, int, String, MessageComparisonMethod) with a position of -1 and using LogAssertionsUtil.MessageComparisonMethod.EQUALS for the comparison method.

      Parameters:
      logCaptor - The log captor to check.
      message - The expected message that was logged along with the throwable. If null, the message will not be checked.

    • assertLogged

      public static void assertLogged(nl.altindag.log.LogCaptor logCaptor, int position, String message)
      Ensures that a message was logged. The assertion will fail if the message was not logged.

      Shortcut for assertLogged(LogCaptor, int, String, MessageComparisonMethod) using LogAssertionsUtil.MessageComparisonMethod.EQUALS for the comparison method.

      Parameters:
      logCaptor - The log captor to check.
      position - The position of the log event to check. 0 means the first (oldest) log event, 1 means the second, etc.

      If the position is negative, the position will be relative to the end of the log events. For example, -1 will get the last log event, -2 will get the second to last, etc.

      message - The expected message that was logged along with the throwable. If null, the message will not be checked.

    • assertLogged

      public static void assertLogged(nl.altindag.log.LogCaptor logCaptor, String message, LogAssertionsUtil.MessageComparisonMethod comparisonMethod)
      Ensures that a message was logged. The assertion will fail if the message was not logged.

      Shortcut for assertLogged(LogCaptor, int, String, MessageComparisonMethod) with an offset of 1.

      Parameters:
      logCaptor - The log captor to check.
      message - The expected message that was logged along with the throwable. If null, the message will not be checked.
      comparisonMethod - The method to use when comparing the expected and actual messages.

    • assertThrowableLogged

      public static void assertThrowableLogged(nl.altindag.log.LogCaptor logCaptor, int position, @Nullable String expectedMessage, Class<?>... expectedTypes)
      Ensures that a throwable with the correct causes was logged. The assertion will fail if the throwable was not logged.

      Shortcut for assertThrowableNesting(Throwable, ThrowableSpec[]).

      Parameters:
      logCaptor - The log captor to check.
      position - The position of the log event to check. 0 means the first (oldest) log event, 1 means the second, etc.

      If the position is negative, the position will be relative to the end of the log events. For example, -1 will get the last log event, -2 will get the second to last, etc.

      expectedMessage - The expected message that was logged along with the throwable. If null, the message will not be checked.
      expectedTypes - The expected composition of the throwable that was logged. See LogAssertionsUtil.ThrowableSpec.matches(Throwable).

    • assertThrowableLogged

      public static void assertThrowableLogged(nl.altindag.log.LogCaptor logCaptor, int position, @Nullable String expectedMessage, Class<?> throwableType0, @Nullable String throwableMessage0)
      Ensures that a throwable with the correct causes was logged. The assertion will fail if the throwable was not logged.

      Shortcut for assertThrowableNesting(Throwable, ThrowableSpec[]) with ThrowableSpec(Class, String).

      Parameters:
      logCaptor - The log captor to check.
      position - The position of the log event to check. 0 means the first (oldest) log event, 1 means the second, etc.

      If the position is negative, the position will be relative to the end of the log events. For example, -1 will get the last log event, -2 will get the second to last, etc.

      expectedMessage - The expected message that was logged along with the throwable. If null, the message will not be checked.
      throwableType0 - The expected type of the base throwable.
      throwableMessage0 - The expected message of the base throwable.

    • assertThrowableLogged

      public static void assertThrowableLogged(nl.altindag.log.LogCaptor logCaptor, int position, @Nullable String expectedMessage, Class<?> throwableType0, @Nullable String throwableMessage0, Class<?> throwableType1, @Nullable String throwableMessage1)
      Ensures that a throwable with the correct causes was logged. The assertion will fail if the throwable was not logged.

      Shortcut for assertThrowableNesting(Throwable, ThrowableSpec[]) with ThrowableSpec(Class, String).

      Parameters:
      logCaptor - The log captor to check.
      position - The position of the log event to check. 0 means the first (oldest) log event, 1 means the second, etc.

      If the position is negative, the position will be relative to the end of the log events. For example, -1 will get the last log event, -2 will get the second to last, etc.

      expectedMessage - The expected message that was logged along with the throwable. If null, the message will not be checked.
      throwableType0 - The expected type of the base throwable.
      throwableMessage0 - The expected message of the base throwable.
      throwableType1 - The expected type of the first nested throwable.
      throwableMessage1 - The expected message of the first nested throwable.

      public static void assertThrowableLogged(nl.altindag.log.LogCaptor logCaptor, int position, @Nullable String expectedMessage, Class<?> throwableType0, @Nullable String throwableMessage0, Class<?> throwableType1, @Nullable String throwableMessage1, Class<?> throwableType2, @Nullable String throwableMessage2)

      Shortcut for assertThrowableNesting(Throwable, ThrowableSpec[]) with ThrowableSpec(Class, String).

      Parameters:
      logCaptor - The log captor to check.
      position - The position of the log event to check. 0 means the first (oldest) log event, 1 means the second, etc.

      If the position is negative, the position will be relative to the end of the log events. For example, -1 will get the last log event, -2 will get the second to last, etc.

      expectedMessage - The expected message that was logged along with the throwable. If null, the message will not be checked.
      throwableType0 - The expected type of the base throwable.
      throwableMessage0 - The expected message of the base throwable.
      throwableType1 - The expected type of the first nested throwable.
      throwableMessage1 - The expected message of the first nested throwable.
      throwableType2 - The expected type of the second nested throwable.
      throwableMessage2 - The expected message of the second nested throwable.

      public static void assertThrowableLogged(nl.altindag.log.LogCaptor logCaptor, int position, @Nullable String expectedMessage, Class<?> throwableType0, @Nullable String throwableMessage0, Class<?> throwableType1, @Nullable String throwableMessage1, Class<?> throwableType2, @Nullable String throwableMessage2, Class<?> throwableType3, @Nullable String throwableMessage3)
      Ensures that a throwable with the correct causes was logged. The assertion will fail if the throwable was not logged.

      Shortcut for assertThrowableNesting(Throwable, ThrowableSpec[]) with ThrowableSpec(Class, String).

      Parameters:
      logCaptor - The log captor to check.
      position - The position of the log event to check. 0 means the first (oldest) log event, 1 means the second, etc.

      If the position is negative, the position will be relative to the end of the log events. For example, -1 will get the last log event, -2 will get the second to last, etc.

      expectedMessage - The expected message that was logged along with the throwable. If null, the message will not be checked.
      throwableType0 - The expected type of the base throwable.

      throwableMessage2 - The expected message of the second nested throwable.
      throwableType3 - The expected type of the third nested throwable.
      throwableMessage3 - The expected message of the third nested throwable.

    • assertThrowableLogged

      public static void assertThrowableLogged(nl.altindag.log.LogCaptor logCaptor, int position, @Nullable String expectedMessage, LogAssertionsUtil.ThrowableSpec... throwableSpecs)
      Ensures that a throwable with the correct causes was logged. The assertion will fail if the throwable was not logged.
      Parameters:
      logCaptor - The log captor to check.
      position - The position of the log event to check. 0 means the first (oldest) log event, 1 means the second, etc.

      If the position is negative, the position will be relative to the end of the log events. For example, -1 will get the last log event, -2 will get the second to last, etc.

      expectedMessage - The expected message that was logged along with the throwable. If null, the message will not be checked.
      throwableSpecs - The expected composition of the throwable that was logged. See assertThrowableNesting(Throwable, ThrowableSpec[]).

    • assertThrowableNesting

      public static void assertThrowableNesting(@Nullable Throwable base, Class<?>... expectedTypes)
      Ensures that a throwable has the correct causes. The assertion will fail if the throwables do not match the expected nesting.

      Shortcut for assertThrowableNesting(Throwable, ThrowableSpec[]) with LogAssertionsUtil.ThrowableSpec.of(Class[]).

      None of the messages will be checked.

      Parameters:
      base - The base throwable to check.
      expectedTypes - The expected composition of the throwable that was logged. See LogAssertionsUtil.ThrowableSpec.matches(Throwable).

    • assertThrowableNesting

      public static void assertThrowableNesting(@Nullable Throwable base, LogAssertionsUtil.ThrowableSpec... throwableSpecs)
      Ensures that a throwable has the correct causes. The assertion will fail if the throwables do not match the expected nesting.

      This method checks the nesting of the throwables, meaning that the first throwable in the array is expected to be the root cause of the second, which is expected to be the root cause of the third, and so on.

      If the base throwable is null, the method will throw an AssertionFailedError.

      For each throwable spec, the method will ensure that the throwable matches the provided spec. See LogAssertionsUtil.ThrowableSpec.matches(Throwable).

      For example, when providing "[{RuntimeException.class, null}, IOException.class, "Error"]" the following exception would be required to have been logged: new RuntimeException(new IOException("Error"));

      Parameters:
      base - The base throwable to check.
      throwableSpecs - The expected composition of the throwable that was logged.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If no throwables are specified.
      org.opentest4j.AssertionFailedError - If the throwables do not match the expected nesting.

    • getThrowingCount

      public static int getThrowingCount(nl.altindag.log.LogCaptor logCaptor)
      Gets the number of log events that were logged with a throwable.
      Parameters:
      logCaptor - The log captor to check.
      Returns:
      The number of log events that were logged with a throwable.
